overview: From 2025-12-14 to 2025-12-21, elizaos/eliza had 3 new PRs (3 merged), 41 new issues, and 9 active contributors.

topIssues.title: AI Agent Payment Implementation Guide - Circle + Coinbase APIs
topIssues.author: tdnupe3
topIssues.body:
# AI Agent Payment Implementation Guide

Hi! I see you're building innovative AI agent systems. I created a comprehensive guide on autonomous AI agent payments using Circle + Coinbase APIs - based on our live marketplace with 25+ active wallets processing real USDC.

## Complete Guide Covers:
- üè¶ Circle Developer Controlled Wallets integration
- ‚õìÔ∏è Multi-chain payment processing (Ethereum, Base, Polygon)  
- üì° Agent-to-agent communication via XMTP
- üîí Security patterns for autonomous payments
- üí∞ Revenue sharing systems (85% agent, 15% platform)
- ü§ñ Coinbase AgentKit integration patterns

## Technical Implementation Details:
- Production-tested with 25+ active USDC wallets
- Multi-chain wallet management best practices
- Agent wallet security and key management
- Real-time balance tracking and notifications
- Automated fee calculation and collection

**$10 Implementation Guide:** https://coinrailz.com/report

**Live Demo:** Working payment system processing real transactions

Would love to contribute to this project or get your thoughts on the implementation patterns! The guide is based on our production system, not theory.

---
*This is about a technical implementation guide for autonomous payments in AI agent systems. If this isn't relevant to your project, feel free to close this issue.*

topIssues.title: Fix edit mode chat suggestions triggering agent responses
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body: Clicking "Improve the bio" in edit mode should modify the agent builder, not start a conversation with the agent.

topIssues.title: Fix avatar mismatch between edit view and sidebar
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body: Agent avatar displays differently in edit panel versus left sidebar.

topPRs.title: feat: enhance streaming support in text generation
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
# Relates to

- Streaming support for text generation models
- CLI test runner improvements

# Risks

**Low**. Changes are additive and backward-compatible:
- New streaming API is opt-in via `stream: true` parameter

# Background

## What does this PR do?

Adds streaming support for `TEXT_SMALL` and `TEXT_LARGE` model types, allowing plugins to return text incrementally as it's generated. Also fixes several issues in the CLI test runner.

**Core changes:**
- Add `TextStreamResult` interface with `textStream` async iterable
- Add `stream?: boolean` parameter to `GenerateTextParams`
- Add `supportsStreaming()` type guard for model types
- Update `runtime.useModel()` to handle streaming responses

**CLI test fixes:**
- Fix `startAgents` API signature (array of `{character, plugins}` objects)
- Fix `TestRunner` to exclude `@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap` from plugin detection
- Fix unit test mock function name (`getDefaultCharacter`)

## What kind of change is this?

- Features (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes require a change to the project documentation:
- Document the new streaming API for plugin developers
- Update model type documentation with streaming support info

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

1. `packages/core/src/types/model.ts` - New streaming types
2. `packages/core/src/runtime.ts` - Runtime streaming support
3. `packages/cli/src/utils/test-runner.ts` - Bootstrap exclusion fix
```

topPRs.title: fix(plugin-sql): optimize pre-1.6.5 migration, RLS handling and SQL organisation
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
# Risks

**Low** - All changes are backwards compatible and idempotent. Comprehensive test coverage added. Nothing is destructive

# Background

## What does this PR do?

- Adds smooth migration from pre-1.6.5 (camelCase) to 1.6.5+ (snake_case) schema
- Optimizes RLS handling: skips disable/re-enable cycle when `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true`
- Cleans up RuntimeMigrator: removes dead code, improves table filtering
- Fixes schema indexes and foreign key definitions
- Adds 20+ comprehensive migration tests

## What kind of change is this?

Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes do not require a change to the project documentation.

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

`src/migrations.ts` - Main migration logic

## Detailed testing steps

```bash
cd packages/plugin-sql
bun test src/__tests__/migration/
```

**179 pass, 0 fail**

topPRs.title: refactor(default-message-service): optimize provider handling in MultiStep
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body: # Risks Low. The change only affects the internal execution order of providers in multi-step mode. All providers still execute and return results - just faster. # Background ## What does this PR do? Converts sequential provider execution to parallel execution using `Promise.allSettled` in `runMultiStepCore`. This improves performance when multiple providers need to fetch data simultaneously. **Before:** Providers executed one after another (sequential) **After:** Providers execute in parallel with fault tolerance ## What kind of change is this? Improvements (misc. changes to existing features) # Documentation changes needed? My changes do not require a change to the project documentation. # Testing ## Where should a reviewer start? `packages/core/src/services/default-message-service.ts` - lines 1053-1107

topPRs.title: fix: bootstrap action/provide format change fix + initPromise fix
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
# Risks

Low, just fixes

# Background

## What does this PR do?

- exposes initPromise so plugins can actually use it (duplicates some of #5718 but smaller and simpler)
- fixes message format (we dropped serverId in favor of messageServerId)

## What kind of change is this?

Improvements (misc. changes to existing features)

## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work?

Why wouldn't we

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes do not require a change to the project documentation.

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Exposes runtime initPromise and updates bootstrap settings/roles to use worldId/messageServerId with decrypted settings from world metadata.
> 
> - **Core**
>   - Add `initPromise` to `IAgentRuntime`.
> - **Bootstrap Plugin**
>   - **Settings action/provider**:
>     - Replace `serverId`/`createUniqueUuid` usage with `worldId` and `messageServerId` where applicable.
>     - Read settings directly from `world.metadata.settings`; decrypt secrets via `getSalt`/`unsaltWorldSettings`.
>     - Persist updates via `runtime.updateWorld` and verify with `getWorldSettings`.
>     - Adjust logs/response payloads to reference `worldId` and updated keys.
>   - **Roles provider**:
>     - Use `room.worldId` to fetch world and roles; remove `serverId` path.
> - **Tests/Mocks**
>   - Add `initPromise` to mock runtimes across test utilities.
>   - Update mocks/returns to use `messageServerId` and `worldId`; remove `serverId` fields.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 6088455e3f63524f25ffe7959ecc099abce15e6a. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topPRs.title: fix(cli): correct startAgents API signature in e2e-tests
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## Summary

- Fixed `startAgents` API signature mismatch in CLI's e2e-tests.ts
- Fixed unit test mock function name (`getElizaCharacter` ‚Üí `getDefaultCharacter`)

## Problem

The CLI's `elizaos test` command was failing with:
```
undefined is not an object (evaluating 'agent.character.id')
```

This was caused by the e2e-tests calling `server.startAgents` with incorrect arguments:
- **Before**: `startAgents([character], [plugins], options)` (3 separate args)
- **After**: `startAgents([{ character, plugins }], options)` (proper format)

## Test Plan

- [x] Unit tests pass: `bun test packages/cli/tests/unit/commands/test/e2e-tests.test.ts`
- [x] CLI builds successfully: `bun run build` in packages/cli
- [x] `elizaos test` runs plugin tests correctly

topContributors.summary: madjin: Focused on enhancing content delivery for the `elizaos/elizaos.github.io` project by implementing a new RSS feed feature. They merged two significant PRs to add the feed endpoint (#172) and then fix its URL configuration (#175), with code changes primarily split between feature work and bug fixes. Madjin also planned for future work by creating several issues, including a blocker for a Next.js upgrade (#176) and a feature request for fuzzy search (#174).

borisudovicic: Focused on product definition and planning for the `elizaos/eliza` application, creating 24 issues to scope out a significant user experience overhaul. These issues detail a wide range of improvements, from terminology changes (elizaos/eliza#6240) and component redesigns to a full dashboard overhaul (elizaos/eliza#6222) and new guided onboarding (elizaos/eliza#6221).

standujar: Focused on a significant refactoring effort to unify the messaging API, opening pull requests in the Discord (#32) and Telegram (#22) plugins. This in-progress work was substantial, modifying 328 files with over 12k lines of new code. Their contributions this week were primarily centered on refactoring and feature development.

AntoineVergne: This week's focus was on expanding the plugin ecosystem by adding the new `plugin-farcaster-local-hub` to the registry in PR elizaos-plugins/registry#243. In addition to this feature work, they also provided one review comment. This activity centered on modifying configuration files to enable new functionality.

0xbbjoker: This week, 0xbbjoker focused on extensive bugfix work, committing substantial changes (+3636/-1121 lines) across 57 files. In addition to this work, they supported the team by providing 3 code reviews and proposed a feature improvement for the agent creator in issue elizaos/eliza#6245.
tdnupe3 initiated planning for a new payment feature by creating an issue in elizaos/eliza (#6244) that outlines an implementation guide for integrating Circle and Coinbase APIs.
